summary: This is a court subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Amazon.com, Inc., commanding the company to appear and produce subscriber records, order history, billing/shipping information, and payment details from January 1, 1994, to January 1, 2005, for specified identifiers in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The subpoena is dated September 27, 2021, and requires Amazon's appearance on November 29, 2021.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)), for which this subpoena is issued to obtain records from Amazon.com, Inc.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed and issued this subpoena on September 27, 2021.

connections.description: Audrey Strauss, as United States Attorney, is prosecuting Ghislaine Maxwell in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, as evidenced by this subpoena she issued.

events.title: Scheduled Court Appearance for Amazon.com, Inc.
events.description: Amazon.com, Inc. is commanded to appear before the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York at 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 906, at 9:00 a.m. to testify and produce records in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Issuance of Subpoena to Amazon.com, Inc.
events.description: United States Attorney Audrey Strauss issued a subpoena to Amazon.com, Inc., demanding the production of subscriber records, order history, billing/shipping information, and payment details from January 1, 1994, to January 1, 2005, for specified identifiers related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

locations: 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 906, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York, Southern District of New York
Tumwater, WA 98501 (address for Amazon.com, Inc. Corporation Service Company Legal Department â€” Subpoena)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office subpoenaed Amazon.com, Inc. for records spanning from January 1, 1994, to January 1, 2005, in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

The subpoena demands subscriber records, order history, billing/shipping information, and means and source of payment for specified identifiers, indicating an investigation into financial and transactional activities.
The subpoena was issued by United States Attorney Audrey Strauss on September 27, 2021, with a court appearance scheduled for November 29, 2021.
The document is part of the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), showing ongoing legal proceedings in the Southern District of New York.
